title: The Easiest Way to Look Put-Together: Dress in One Color Head-to-Toe
sub_head: Single-hue outfits in shades like pink, emerald and subdued sandy beige are populating runways and city sidewalks alike. How to skillfully (and un-creepily) assemble a monochrome look.
body:
MANY MEN FEAR colorful clothes. They’ll sprinkle in the rare cayenne sweater or canary button-up but mainly stick to safe tans and pale grays. Joshua Safran is not one of these men.
The TV writer and producer (currently the showrunner of HBO Max’s “Gossip Girl” reboot) has dressed in head-to-toe, single-hue looks for about five years. Starting with modest monochrome outfits of steady blues, he eventually upped the ante, adopting matching sets in jolting shades such as lemon-yellow and burgundy. He is so committed to the cause that he has considered purchasing color-synced underwear. Color-matching is “something that brings me a lot of joy,” said Mr. Safran, 47.
